title: Alan Todd May (Cobb County Police Department)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Georgia Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

All documents relating to the investigation of Alan May Todd in 1990 and 1991.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Katie King

communications.subject: FOIA 5538 Park District Emails - HK, ES
communications.communication:
Dear Requestor,



Thank you for your interest in obtaining information from the Chicago Park District.



Your FOIA reference number for tracking purposes is: 5538



You have requested the following records:



“Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

Records sufficient to show the following email logs: A log of all emails to/from Heather Keil from March 1, 2024 through the date this request is processed. The logs should include but not be limited to: sender, recipient(s), date, time, subject line, and attachment name. Please include emails where Heather is cc'ed and bcc'ed and provide this log in an .xls format.

Records sufficient to show the following email logs: A log of all emails to/from Erika Saltzman from March 1, 2024 through the date this request is processed. The logs should include but not be limited to: sender, recipient(s), date, time, subject line, and attachment name. Please include emails where Erika is cc'ed and bcc'ed and provide this log in an .xls format.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes. Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.”



Chicago Park District (the “Park District”) responds to all public records requests by the Illinois Freedom of Information Act (FOIA), 5 ILCS 140/1 et seq.  Please expect a response by Wednesday March 27, 2024 by close of business. If additional time is needed to assemble and copy all documents responsive to your FOIA request, we will contact you with a time estimate and a request to extend.



Kind regards,

Karen Choudhury

https://www.straxis.com/about.php

Straxis Technology
1305 E. 15th Street
Tulsa, Oklahoma  74120

communications.communication:

title: SY23, N2: Notices of 5 and 10 day student unexcused absences and notices of truancy intervention services

communications.subject: Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request: SY23, N2: Notices of 5 and 10 day student unexcused absences and notices of truancy intervention services
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

records sufficient to show the number of notices sent to schools of students who have 5 and 10 days of unexcused absences by school and by month for the 2022-2023 school year, issued by schools in network two.

records sufficient to show the number of notices sent "pupil's parent or guardian a letter, by certified mail, return receipt requested, notifying the parent or guardian that he or she is subjecting himself or herself to truancy intervention services", by school and by month for the 2022-2023 school year issued by schools in network two.

By network two shools, i mean the following school:
BRENNEMANN
CHAPPELL
COONLEY
COURTENAY
DECATUR
DISNEY
FIELD
GALE
GOUDY
HAYT
JAMIESON
JORDAN
KILMER
MCCUTCHEON
MCPHERSON
MOSAIC
NEW FIELD
RAVENSWOOD
STONE
SWIFT
WATERS

Please note that I am not seeking any personally identifiable information or otherwise exempt information. As required by the statute, please ensure that the requested documents are redacted rather than exempting the entirety of the document. Additionally, for any and all exemptions used to redact exempt information, please provide clear and convincing evidence for each exemption used by your agency.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Forest Gregg

To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Any summary statistics or reports available on Russian securities (stocks, ADRs, bonds, EFTs and mutual funds) traded on US exchanges before Russian sanctions began in February 2022.  Please include: 1. Market value of securities before sanctions  2. Market losses following sanctions  3. Percentage of these securities owned by politically connected persons in the Russia Federation  4. Percentage of securities owned by Russian citizens vs. US citizens vs. third country citizens  5. Value, dates and ownership of very large sales of Russian securities during February 2022  6. Statistics on the dates and value of short sales and options trades during February 2022  7. Estimated percent of total Russian security value traded on US exchanges before sanctions

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

Sincerely,

Sherman McCall

title: Madres Contra la Guerra Contact with the FBI

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Reports show that US officials have insinuated that the FBI investigate Pro-Palestine groups: https://www.rollingstone.com/politics/politics-news/pelosi-fbi-pro-palestine-protesters-russia-1234955648/

Tweets show members of Puerto Rican Pro-Palestine group "Madres Contra la Guerra" believe they have been visited, surveilled, and/or interviewed by the FBI: https://x.com/ManuelEMelende5/status/1769780724209455420?s=20  

The purpose of this request is to obtain information for the public on FBI surveillance of Madres Contra la Guerra, surveillance of the aforementioned group, decisions on surveillance, and the impact it has on anti-war groups. This information will enable the public to engage in an important ongoing policy debate and the upcoming Congressional appropriations debate.

In this request, ‘records’ includes, but is not limited to, all records or communications preserved in electronic or written form, such as correspondences, emails, documents, data, videotapes, audio tapes, faxes, files, guidances, guidelines, analyses, memoranda, agreements, notes, orders, policies, procedures, legal opinions, protocols, reports, rules, or manuals.

Therefore, I request the following records:

1) Any communications, messages, emails, and attachments exchanged within the FBI concerning "Madres Contra la Guerra" or their spokesperson Sonia Santiago Hernández.  

2) Any communications, messages, emails, and attachments exchanged between the FBI and other law enforcement agencies (including but not limited to the Puerto Rico Police Department and the Department of Homeland Security) concerning "Madres Contra la Guerra" or their spokesperson Sonia Santiago Hernández.  

3) Any after action reports and executive summaries after surveillance of or contact with "Madres Contra la Guerra" or their spokesperson Sonia Santiago Hernández.  Please include any notes taken before, during, or after contact or surveillance with the aforementioned group or subject.

4) Any presentations, videos, audios, transcripts, and attachments used to educate FBI personnel or personnel from any other law enforcement agency about "Madres Contra la Guerra" or their spokesperson Sonia Santiago Hernández.

Please do a search of main file records alongside cross-reference records and an ELSUR (electronic surveillance) records. Additionally, please search the Sentinel database, the Investigative Data Warehouse, and the Data Integration and Visualization System.

This request is for all records produced between Jan 1, 2024 and the time this request is processed. In the event there are multiple records, please send them to me on a rolling basis.

I ask that this request be given expedited processing and be placed on the simple track given the relative simplicity of the request and the short time span in which the requested records would have been produced.

This request is not being done for commercial purposes and will be made available to the general public. The records released by this request are likely to contribute significantly to public understanding of the operations or activities of the governmentI am an independent journalist and any responsive records will be used in the course of reporting about Pro-Palestine protests in Puerto Rico.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Carlos Berríos Polanco

title: Idaho Medicaid Provider List with NPI, Idaho State Licensed Healthcare Practitioner List with NPI

communications.subject: Idaho Public Records Act Request: Idaho Medicaid Provider List with NPI, Idaho State Licensed Healthcare Practitioner List with NPI
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Idaho Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting an opportunity to inspect or obtain copies of public records that include an updated list of all Idaho State Medicaid healthcare providers and ALL Idaho state licensed healthcare providers via an electronic data set (either CSV, excel, or PDF electronic format) to include all Dentists, and Dental Assistants. All types of licensed healthcare practitioners (Dentists, and Dental Assistants. Regardless of general or specialization.) from all dates electronically available would be appreciated. Specific items to be included in the data set: 
1. Provider name
2. National Provider Identification (NPI) number
3. Idaho State Healthcare License number and initial date of issuance or expiry (if available/applicable)
4. Education / School/Training, if available
5. Provider type (DDS, DMD, etc.)
6. Specialty
7. Practice Location
 
If there are any fees for searching or copying these records, please inform me of such instances.  However, I would also like to request a waiver of all fees in that the disclosure of the requested information is in the public interest and will contribute significantly to the public’s healthcare transparency, fairness, and public awareness.
If you expect a significant delay in responding to and fulfilling this request, please contact me by phone or via email with information about when I might expect copies or the ability to inspect the requested records.
If you deny any or all of this request, please cite each specific exemption you feel justifies the refusal to release the information and notify me of the appeal procedures available to me under the law.
Thank you for considering my request.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

David Kalayanaprapruit

Sincerely,

Skylar Ferguson

Your request is being processed in accordance with the Nevada Public Records Act (NPRA), Nevada Revised Statutes (NRS) Chapter 239, and the Nevada System of Higher Education (NSHE) Board of Regents Handbook and Policies. Pursuant to NRS 239.0107(1)(c) within five (5) business days from the day after receiving this request for public record, the UNLV Office of Public Affairs will provide records or notify the requester of of the following: one 
 
  * Provide readily available record(s) to the requester for inspection or copying 
  * Give notice that the University is not the custodian of the record(s) and, if known, refer the requester to the appropriate state agency to request the record(s) 
  * Give notice that the record(s) will not be available within the five-day period and provide an estimated date when the record will be available for release. 
  * Provide notice that the request for release is denied, in part or in whole, and state the legal basis for its decision. If we release records, you can download them for a limited period of 60 days. 
 PLEASE NOTE: Nevada Administrative Code (NAC 239.867) provides no requirement for state agencies to create a public record that does not exist. Requests for information, legal research, or answers to general questions are not subject to the Nevada Public Records Act and will be handled accordingly.

communications.subject: [Records Center] Public Records Request :: R001728-031824
communications.communication:
--- Please respond above this line --- 

 RE: PUBLIC RECORDS REQUEST updated 03/19/2024, Request # R001728-031824 Dear Skylar Ferguson, Clarification on the following item(s) is required for us to continue processing your request. The University’s obligation is to produce public records for inspection or copying upon receipt of a request that “is sufficient to identify the record.”  Nevada Administrative Code (NAC) 239.863(c).  In addressing this issue, courts have held that “agencies are required to disclose only ‘identifiable’ governmental records not otherwise exempt;” “the request to the agency must itself be focused and specific.” Rogers v. Superior Court, 19 Cal.App.4th 469, 481 (1993). “Wholesale requests for general information to be analyzed, collected and compiled by the responding government entity are not encompassed therein.” Hodai v. City of Tucson, C20141225 (Ariz. Super. Ct. 2014) citing mag Entertainment LLC v. Div. of Alcohol Beverages Control, 868 A.2d 1067. 1076 (N.J. Sup. Ct., App. Div. 2005).  A government agency is not required to respond to an overly broad request that does not seek specific records.  Id. at 1074, citing Capitol Info. Assoc. v. Ann Arbor Police, 360 N.W.2d 262, 263 (1985). 
Your request for: Here, your request does not reasonably describe a public record in a manner that is sufficient to identify the record sought, as required by Nevada law.  Instead, it seeks to persons with an entire division.  This request requires a search through thousands of university records in order to produce record all communication" without specifying the type of communication, s that respond to the overly broad and/or unclear request.  The resources required to comply with your request, as written, are unfeasible.  It is not possible to estimate the amount of time needed for research, review, and redacting confidential information, as required by law.  Nevada Revised Statutes (NRS) 239.010 and Donrey of NV v. Bradshaw, 106 Nev. 630, 798 P.2d 144 (1990).  
  *   All agreements/contracts between the University Student Affairs, Starship, and/or Aramark regarding the use and policies of the Delivery Robots, or regarding Personal Delivery Devices. 
 
  *  The UNLV dining contract with Aramark was released to you on 3/13/2024, in response to request R001711. 
  *   All communication between the University Student Affairs and Starship regarding the Personal Delivery Devices/Delivery Robots. 
 
  *  As previously stated, the University does not have an agreement with Starship. Aramark has a contract with Grubhub and Grubhub has an agreement with Starship. 
  *  There are different means of communicating information. 
 
  *  What specific "communication" type are you looking for? 
  *  To everyone within the Division of Student Affairs or those in   All communication between the University Student Affairs and Aramark regarding the Personal Delivery Devices/Delivery Robots. 
 
  *  There are different means of communicating information. 
 
 
  *  What specific "communication" type are you looking for? 
  *  To everyone within the Division of Student Affairs or those in For 2. and 3. above, please provide additional information to clarify or help identify the records you seek. Use the format below and tell us exactly what search you want conducted. Documentation search: 
Identify UNLV Staff communications Provide either the title/role or name To: Who? 
Identify UNLV Staff communications Provide either the title/role or name From: Who? 
List the Search Term(s): (Please be as specific as possible when listing subjects. Broad terms will produce unresponsive results and further delay the completion of your request.) 
ALL: Each responsive document/email will include all of the terms listed. (Ex. "Engineering Building" AND "senior design" AND "winners" must appear in the email) 
DUAL: Each responsive document/email will include a combination of two subjects. (Ex. "senior design" AND "winners" must appear in the email) 
AT LEAST: Each responsive document/email will include at least one of the subjects listed. (Ex. "College of Engineering" OR "senior design" OR "winners" must appear in the email) 
Search Dates: From to 8/01/2023 03/18/2024 
For University of Nevada, Las Vegas to proceed with your public information request, please provide clarifications within 14 calendar days from 03/19/2024. If we do not receive a response from you within 14 calendar days, your request will be deemed withdrawn and will be closed. 
You may respond via:  
  *  replying to this message 
  *  sending an email to publicrecords@unlv.edu (mailto:publicrecords@unlv.edu) 
  *  calling the Office of Public Affairs at (702) 895-3102 regular mail to: University of Nevada, Las Vegas 4505 S. Maryland Parkway, Box 451012 Las Vegas, NV 89154 Upon receipt of your clarification, the University of Nevada, Las Vegas will determine if it identifies a record and provide you with an estimated date of completion. Sincerely, Office of Public Affairs 
University of Nevada, Las Vegas

communications.subject: The Missouri Sunshine Law Request: MSHP Incident Info 3/1/24
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Missouri Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

Records that show all initial and follow up incident reporting information pertaining to the incident that took place on Friday morning, March 1, 2024 on and near highway 270 northbound lanes, just before the highway 70 interchange between the hours of 8am and 10am.

Copies of all records that show additional vehicle incidents that occurred on highway 270 between the interchanges of highways 44 and highway 70 that took place during the same hours. Please include documents that show details of vehicles make and model, that identify all local, state and federal law enforcement and safety agencies that collaborated in response to the incidents and that indicate whether there were any injuries or fatalities.

I am also requesting all traffic and safety camera footage from the same section of highway along 270 between the interchanges of highway 44 and West Florissant Ave for the same timeframe of 8am to 10am

I request that fees be waived as I believe this request is in the public’s interest. I am seeking the records to analyze, inform and freely release to members of the public as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com. The requested records are not for commercial use.

I am willing to pay all reasonable duplication expenses incurred in the processing this Sunshine Law request. If fees cannot be waived, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request be filled electronically or by CD-ROM if necessary.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,
Kevin Hawkins

communications.subject: Public Records Request :: P048067-031824
communications.communication:
Dear Kevin Hawkins: 
Our office received your open records request pursuant to Missouri's Sunshine Law, Chapter 610, RSMo. Your request has been assigned number P048067-031824. The Patrol is committed to adhering to the Sunshine Law and to ensuring that the public obtains access to open records that are not otherwise closed by law. The Sunshine Law requires each public agency to adhere to certain standards. This letter is designed to ensure that you understand our process for fulfilling your records request. Three Business Day Notice Requirement: 
The requested records are not immediately available for dissemination or inspection. The Patrol is required to notify you that additional research time will be required to fulfill the request. This correspondence satisfies the Sunshine Law's notice requirement within the required three business day period. Section 610.023.3, RSMo. 
 Additional Research Time is Required: 
The Patrol receives thousands of open records requests each month. Our Patrol Records Division personnel are dedicated to meeting the intent of Missouri's Sunshine Law and strive to respond to each request in a timely manner. The Patrol operates in all 114 Missouri counties and the independent city of St. Louis. Accordingly, many records maintained by the agency are not centrally located within, or immediately accessible to, the Patrol's Custodian of Records in Jefferson City. Our staff must research your request and ensure that we have captured all responsive records  ̶  regardless of their location within the agency. The research process is time-consuming, but we will make every effort to expedite your request. Estimated Time for Completion: 
The majority of our requests are fulfilled within thirty business days. Some requests require additional research time due to their scope or complexity. Our team will conduct an initial review of your request. If we estimate that the request will be fulfilled within thirty business days, we will not send an updated time estimate. However, if we estimate that the request will take longer than thirty business days, we will provide an updated time estimate that provides a detailed justification for the additional research time. Billing: 
As it relates to billing, Missouri law allows the Patrol to charge fees for copies and research time. Specifically, "[r]esearch time required for fulfilling records requests may be charged at the actual cost of research time." Section 610.026, RSMo. The Missouri Supreme Court recently determined that "staff time is the time required to provide access to public records maintained on computer facilities, recording tapes or disks, videotapes or films, pictures, maps, slides, graphics, illustrations or similar audio or visual items". Gross v. Parson, 624 S.W.3d 877, 884-89 (Mo. 2021) (internal quotations omitted). 
The Patrol will never bill you for redaction time or any research time conducted by our legal staff. You will only be charged for copies and staff research time as permitted by Missouri law. Please let us know if you have questions related to the billing estimate. 
Our team will forward a bill estimate to your attention once we have calculated the permissible costs and fees. The Patrol will not provide the responsive records until receipt of payment. Section 610.026.2, RSMo. 
We appreciate your patience as we review, research, and fulfill your open records request. You can monitor the progress of your request at the link below and you will receive an email when your request has been completed. If you wish to withdraw or clarify your request, or if you have questions, please call our office at (573) 526-6146, or (573) 526-6167. 
 
Sincerely, 
Gerard G. Callahan 
Custodian of Records 
 
Login Link: https://mshp.govqa.us/WEBAPP/_rs/Login.aspx
